sentences.en: An embankment has been thrown up.
He landed in the long grass of the railway embankment.
sentences.cn: 他落在铁路护堤边的深草里.

sentences.en: Slipping his arm into Bette's, he led the way down a side street towards the Embankment.
sentences.cn: 他挽住蓓蒂的胳臂领着大家沿着一条小街朝河岸大道走去.

sentences.en: The bus came off the road and plunged down an embankment.
sentences.cn: 公共汽车驶离了公路,冲下路堤.

sentences.en: The car went out of control on a bend and plummeted down an embankment.
sentences.cn: 车子在弯道处失去控制，一头扎下堤岸。

sentences.en: The embankment is in great peril.
The embankment was destroyed by rush of waters.
The embankment was washed out by the storm.
The trees in the Embankment garden stood bulky against the incandescent Sky - line.
sentences.cn: 河堤花园里的树木背衬着灯光燃炽的夜空巍巍屹立.

sentences.en: The van slipped ( a few feet ) down the embankment.
sentences.cn: 那客货车沿堤坝向下滑动了 ( 几英尺 ).

sentences.en: The waves washed over the sea embankment with a loud crashing noise.
sentences.cn: 波涛拍打着海堤发出巨大的撞击声.
他们爬上了陡峭的堤岸。

sentences.en: Various observation posts - notably a railway embankment overlooking the house - were prominently indicated.
sentences.cn: 他们特意强调了几个观察点,那里是高出地面的铁路路基,可以俯看克里门特的家.

sentences.en: We should reinforce the river embankment before the wet season.
sentences.cn: 雨季前夕,我们要加固河坝.

sentences.en: We walked along the Thames embankment.
sentences.cn: 我们沿着泰晤士河的堤岸散步.

words.tran_cn: 筑堤围堵；以堤围绕；以堤防堵挡

trans.tran_en: a wide wall of earth or stones built to stop water from flooding an area, or to support a road or railway
